item.title: I wish the B/X and OD&D retro-clones had added a "Saving Throw" entry for spells
item.dc:creator: T. Kurt Bond
item.description:
One simple improvement on B/X D&D and OD&D that wouldn't have been a change in the rules, just a change in presentation, that I'd wished that the B/X and OD&D retro-clones had made was adding a “Saving Throw” entry to their spell descriptions was like that of AD&D. Basic Fantasy, Labyrinth Lord/Advanced Edition Companion, Old-School Essentials, and Sword & Wizardry Complete and Core all fail to do this. As it is, you have to read the spell description to figure out if a saving throw is allowed and what it means.

I'm really surprised that Old-School Essentials didn't do this, with all its other improvements to the presentation of B/X style games.

Oh well. Maybe OSE will add it in a later edition.
